page.title: 17LLANSTEFFAN AREA: LEISURE
page.content: Watching television and listening to radio are the commonest leisuretime entertainment. Many people have record players too and some have videos. The nearest cinema is 25 miles away at Llanelli. At Christmas Llansteffan WI put on a pantomime, and each village has a Christmas tree and carolsinging. In summer each village has a carnival with fancy dress competitions and chidren's sports. Llansteffan keeps up its old custom of electing a mock-mayor. Occasionally we book a small touring theatre to perform in the Castle, and sometimes we have a concert by a Welsh male-voice choir in aid of charity. The occasional disco and barbecue are held on The Green or the beach. Each chapel has an annual Cwrdd Mawr (Big Meeting) and on Good Friday all the chapels combine in a Gymanfa Ganu (singing festival).
